title: Recovery of Subsampled EBSD Datasets Using a 3-D Data Volume for Inpainting
content: Electron backscatter diffraction (EBSD) is a scanning electron microscopy (SEM) based technique used to identify crystallographic properties of a sample [1]. In this method a focused probe is raster scanned across a tilted sample. This produces an EBSD pattern consisting of overlapping Kikuchi bands at each probe location, resulting in a 4-dimensional (4-D) dataset.
